pullRequest.title: Reverse proxy config support added
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description:
This fix was requested by the APIM team when certain authentication flows broke upon using the gateway as a reverse proxy to IS-KM after a session hijacking fix.
This PR fixes the aforementioned issue by introducing a new reverse proxy config to replace default contexts with proxy contexts during the authorization code flow.
The introduced configuration model can be used to define a proxy context instead of the default context. Since the reported problem was with the OAuth2 consent page posting to the default /oauth2/authorize context of KM instead of proxied /authorize endpoint of the gateway, this PR addresses only this issue as an immediate fix, causing the authentication endpoint to read this configuration and use the correct endpoint to POST the consent response to [1].
Hence, [1] needs to be merged after merging this PR.
Configuration Model:
This configuration will not be shipped by default. Any customer using the Gateway to proxy endpoints will have to add this configuration. The use of these configurations by any pure IS customers is NOT recommended as this is not a finalized approach to the issue.
To add a reverse proxy config, add the following entry to the deployment.toml per config.
[[reverse_proxy_config]]
default_context = "<DEFAULT_PATH>"
proxy_context = "<PROXY_PATH>"

For example, the following configs in the toml,
[[reverse_proxy_config]]
default_context = "/oauth2/authorize"
proxy_context = "/authorize"

[[reverse_proxy_config]]
default_context = "/oidc/logout"
proxy_context = "/logout"

would lead to the addition of the following to the identity.xml file.
	<ReverseProxyConfig>
	    <ReverseProxy>
		<DefaultContext>/oauth2/authorize</DefaultContext>
		<ProxyContext>/authorize</ProxyContext> 
	    </ReverseProxy>
	    <ReverseProxy>
		<DefaultContext>/oidc/logout</DefaultContext>
		<ProxyContext>/logout</ProxyContext>
	    </ReverseProxy>
	</ReverseProxyConfig> 

Expected Behavior:

When the configuration is in place, the configured proxy context will be used instead of the default context.
When the configuration is not in place, the default context will be used.

[1] wso2/identity-apps#1124

nodes.bodyText: Need new line at the end of the file
Add new line after method signature.

commit.message: Reverse proxy config support added for rewriting proxy context in URLs.
